analyzed: vibhavam sva bhittau sva ātmā samunmīlayasi īśvara īśaḥ
translated: This, O Lord of Lords, you manifest your own Self on your own ground, as the same as the reflection in a mirror, as different and non-different by your own will alone.

analyzed: tvam atra ca ādāyaka tām avāptaḥ param yathā dādeyam idam vidhāya
translated: And here, you have attained the state of being the giver, having made this the supreme gift.

analyzed: nānā anurūpam mithas aucitī iddham svayam vilāsa eka rasa uvabhāsi
translated: Manifesting in various forms, with appropriate radiance, you yourself appear as the essence of all sports.

analyzed: atya sphuṭa idantva mahat tva bhāsā param para ākāra param tat eva
translated: That which appears as the not-so-manifest and the manifest, the supreme and the most supreme, is indeed that very (Brahman).

original: samāhite nityaśivasvabhāve sambhāvya bhāvyaṃ vidi paśyasīśa // //
analyzed: samāhite nitya śiva svabhāve sambhāvya bhāvyam vidi paśyasi īśa
translated: O Lord, you see the future to be realized, in the nature of eternal Śiva, when concentrated.

analyzed: ūrīkṛta īśāna pade sphuṭa tvad para tvam etat tvayi tat tathā eva
translated: When the state of Īśāna is attained, that not-so-manifest and supreme state is indeed in you, just as it is.

analyzed: śākhā vraja avāntara bheda bhinnaḥ mātā samesmin asi vidyayā api
translated: O Mother, you are the same in this (world) divided by the differences of the groups of branches, even by knowledge.

analyzed: jñānākalaḥ kartṛ tayā su śūnyaḥ viśuddha bodhaḥ tad abheda sāram
translated: The Jñānākala (limited being of pure knowledge), devoid of agency, with pure consciousness, sees this, the essence of non-difference,

analyzed: apāra vāram hara paśyasi idam bhaviṣyatām pūrva daśā viśiṣṭam
translated: O Hara, the boundless ocean, superior to the previous state of the future.

analyzed: śūnya pramātṛ tva maye pralīna kalpam tvayi idam laya kevala ipi
translated: This, merged in you, the sole abode of dissolution, consisting of the nature of the void cognizer,

original: mitaṃ vibhinnaṃ parito'pi caitat sākalyatalpe sakalaṃ kaleśa // //
analyzed: mitam vibhinnam paritopi ca etat sākalya talpe sakalam kalā īśa
translated: is limited and differentiated, even though all around, on the bed of totality, O all-powerful one.

analyzed: tām sva prakāśa eka viśuddha dehām śritasya vā anāśrita tām sva śaktyā
translated: The one whose body is pure with self-luminous knowledge, either resorting to you or attaining independence by one's own power,

analyzed: bhāvāḥ abhāva anubhavāḥ tava eva prakāśa kāśāḥ satatam vibhānti
translated: the states, the experiences of non-existence, always shine as the light of manifestation.
Again, of the Supreme One, who is the sole essence of the unsurpassed bliss, light, and consciousness,

original: parasya viśvātigatasya viśvamayasya viśvaṃ tava tat svarūpam // //
analyzed: parasya viśva atigatasya viśva mayasya viśvam tava tat sva rūpam
translated: Your entire form is the universe, which transcends the universe, and is full of the universe.

analyzed: ādāyaka ādeya kathā vimāthaḥ na vastutas te pitu tad tad ādyaiḥ
translated: You are not really the one who takes and the one who gives, but by those and other things,

analyzed: nānā viśeṣaiḥ paramaḥ śivaḥ tvam sphurasi abhedaḥ api vilāsanāthaḥ
translated: You, the Supreme One, shine with various distinctions, and the Lord of Play also shines without distinction.

analyzed: sva ātma eka tā saṃsthita viśva bhāse rūpeṇa mātra ādi ucitena pūrvam
translated: First, in the form suitable for the mother and others, abiding in the unity of your own Self,

analyzed: śūnya ati śūnya ātma tayā prakāśa abhedāt cit aikya aprathayā avabhāsi
translated: You shine with the manifestation of the oneness of consciousness due to the non-difference of light as the Self of emptiness and super-emptiness.

analyzed: saṃvid rasa āśyāna guṇa eka jīvaiḥ tattvaiḥ ca kāyaiḥ bhuvanaiḥ hṛṣīkaiḥ
translated: With the principles that are the sole life of the qualities solidified by the essence of consciousness, with the bodies, worlds, and senses,

original: nānānisargairbhavabhūtidehaḥ saṃkocavān vā prathase yathā tvam // //
analyzed: nānā nisargaiḥ bhavabhūti dehaḥ saṃkocavān vā prathase yathā tvam
translated: Either contracted or expanded, you shine as the body of the prosperity of the world with various natures.

analyzed: tathā sa saṅkoca citi svarūpaḥ viśva eka rūpaḥ api na viśva rūpaḥ
translated: Similarly, although you are of the form of the universe, you are not of the form of the universe, being the form of the universe,

analyzed: druma bīja tulyaḥ tvad abheda sāraḥ
translated: This one who takes, who is like the seed of a tree, is also imagined, but the essence of your non-difference.

analyzed: viśveśvaraḥ yam bhagavān tvam eva param sva saṅkocitayā yathā anyaḥ
translated: This Lord of the universe, you alone, are the Supreme One, as if different due to your own contraction,

original: saṅkoca eṣo'pi vicāryamāṇastvatto vibhinno nahi kiñcanāpi // //
analyzed: saṅkocaḥ eṣaḥ api vicāryamāṇaḥ tvattaḥ vibhinnaḥ nahi kiñcana api
translated: This contraction too, when examined, is not anything different from you at all.

analyzed: etat prabodha prathanam hi jīvanmuktiḥ tvad anya tva matiḥ ca bandhaḥ
translated: This manifestation of enlightenment is indeed jivanmukti, and the notion of being different from you is bondage.

analyzed: na tattvataḥ tau tava nitya mukteḥ manīṣā
translated: In reality, neither of these two exists for you, because you are eternally liberated. Even in bondage, the mind is free from impurity and delusion.

analyzed: svarūpam ācchādya nija icchayā eva saṅkocam ābhāsayate yadā cit
translated: When the consciousness, concealing its own nature, manifests contraction by its own will,

original: guṇāguṇatvaprathayā vibhāti dvayī gatiḥ svasya tadābhidasya // //
analyzed: guṇa aguṇa tva prathayā vibhāti dvayī gatiḥ svasya
translated: and appears with the manifestation of good and bad qualities, then there are two ways for the self-luminous one.
In the case of predominance, the self-consciousness is sometimes touched by the words jñānākala (having knowledge) and so on.

original: kramāt kramādūrdhvapadapraveśe svānāśritatvaṃ bhavati sphuṭaṃ ca // //
analyzed: kramāt kramāt ūrdhva pada praveśe sva anāśrita tvam bhavati sphuṭam ca
translated: Gradually, gradually, when entering the higher stages, it becomes clearly independent.

analyzed: kadāpi saṅkocam amum prasāda pātram vidhāya ātma dhiyā pradhānam
translated: Sometimes, having made this contraction a vessel of grace, the self-luminous consciousness,

original: saṃvit sphurantyasti yadā tadāpi śūnyapramātṛtvamupaiti siddham // //🔽evaṃ citiḥ saṅkucitātmarūpā cetyonmukhī cetanatāvarūḍhā /
analyzed: saṃvid sphurantī asti yadā tadā api śūnya pramātṛ tvam upaiti siddham  evam citiḥ saṅkucita ātma rūpā cetya unmukhī cetana tā avarūḍhā
translated: when it shines forth as the supreme principle, then it attains the state of the void cognizer, which is well-established.🔽Thus, the consciousness, having a contracted form, turned towards the object of thought, and established in the state of sentience,

analyzed: dvaya abhisaṅkocana śocanīyā citta ākhyayā ādāyaka tā ādyayā uktā
translated: is called citta (mind) due to the sorrow of contraction in the form of duality, and is said to be the giver of various things.

analyzed: tatra api tatra api vikalpa rūpā sadā tvad artha anusarā udyatasya
translated: Even there, even there, the form of option is always present in you, intent on following your purpose.

analyzed: jyotiṣṭvam ātmīyam aluptam eva su vyagra rājasya yathā sva rājyam
translated: Just as the king, though very busy, does not lose his own kingdom, so also the light of the Self is never lost.

analyzed: deha ādikāḥ cittam atas pradhānam tad saṃskṛtī iddhā api ca śūnya bhūmiḥ
translated: Therefore, the body and other things are subordinate to the mind, and even the purified state of the mind is like an empty ground.

analyzed: na ca anusandhānam iha anyathā syāt māyā pramātā khalu tad mayā utaḥ
translated: And the connection here cannot be otherwise, for the knower of reality is indeed identified with that.

original: p / nirṇīta evaṃ śiva eva sākṣāt sa cetano grāhakatābhimānī /🔽bhedāyujaiya naitasya vibhedakārairanyasya tattvānupapattito'pi // //
analyzed: nirṇītaḥ evam śivaḥ eva sākṣāt sa cetanaḥ grāhaka tā abhimānī  na etasya vibheda kāraiḥ anyasya tattva anupapattitaḥ pi
translated: Thus it is determined that Śiva Himself is directly that, and He, being conscious, is identified with the subjective aspect.🔽His difference is not caused by the distinctions of others, because the existence of another is not possible.

original: prāṇādisaṅkocamatiḥ sa eko gṛhṇan sasaṅkocapadārthabhedam /🔽prakāśavattvena nijena bhūyo dvidhārthasaṅkocitayā mato'yam // //
analyzed: prāṇa ādi saṅkoca matiḥ saḥ ekaḥ gṛhṇan sa saṅkoca padārtha bhedam  prakāśavat tvena nijena bhūyas dvidhā artha saṅkocitayā matā uyam
translated: He alone, with the contraction of the vital force and other things, perceiving the distinctions of contracted objects,🔽Again, by His own nature of being luminous, He is considered to be contracted in two ways.

analyzed: svapne pi asaṃspṛśya gatau malena svasmin malāni pratisandadhānaḥ
translated: Even in a dream, not touching the two ends, He, being identified with the impurities within Himself,

original: rājā yathā paṅkilabhūmimagnaḥ suptaḥ svarājyaṃ na vidaṃstridhāyam // //
analyzed: rājā yathā paṅkila bhūmi magnaḥ suptaḥ sva rājyam na vidan tridhā ayam
translated: Like a king sunk in muddy ground, asleep, not knowing His own kingdom in three ways.

analyzed: sa prāṇa puryaṣṭaka deha śūnya svabhāva bhāvī prathitaḥ caturdhā
translated: He, who is the essence of the nature of the empty body consisting of the vital force and the eight constituents, is proclaimed in four ways.

analyzed: balaiḥ cit ādyaiḥ svayam ajña bhāvāt vidyā ādi tāptaiḥ api pañcadhā ayam
translated: Even by the five, beginning with strength, due to one's own ignorance, and even by those who have attained knowledge etc.

analyzed: ṣaḍadhva māna abhimukhaḥ ca ṣoḍhā pramātṛ bodhāt kila saptadhā ayam
translated: And this is sixfold, facing the six paths, due to the knowledge of the cognizer, indeed it is sevenfold.

analyzed: aṣṭa prathām yāti puri īśvara tvāt prayāti upāyaiḥ triguṇaiḥ nava tvam
translated: It attains the manifestation of eight, due to lordship over the city, it attains the state of nine by means of the three qualities.

analyzed: deva īśvara tve sa daśa tvam āptaḥ tad tad svabhāvāt api madhya saṃkhyī
translated: In the state of lord of gods, he attains the state of ten, and also by the nature of each, he is of middle number.

original: pañcīkṛtaiḥ saptavidhairvibhāgī tatsaṃkhyayā mātṛbhireṣa sa tvam // //
analyzed: pañcīkṛtaiḥ saptavidhaiḥ vibhāgī tad saṃkhyayā mātṛbhiḥ eṣa sa tvam
translated: He is divided by the seven kinds of refined elements, and by the mothers of that number, you are he.

original: svīkṛtya devejyamatādi bhātāstvaṃ bhūmikāḥ khelasi nityamuktaḥ /
analyzed: svīkṛtya devejya mata ādi bhātāḥ tvam bhūmikāḥ khelasi nityam uktaḥ
translated: Having accepted the views of the worshipers of gods etc., you play in the stages, eternally liberated.

original: ayaṃ paraḥ śāmbarikaḥ sa ko'pi vivādaraṅgaṃ bahudhāvabhāsya // //
analyzed: ayam paraḥ śāmbarikaḥ sa kopi vivāda raṅgam bahudhā avabhāsya
translated: This is some supreme Śāmbharika, having illuminated the arena of debate in many ways,

original: lokātiśāyi pravilokya lakṣmībalaṃ vilāsaikaphalaṃ viśālam /🔽ānandanaṃ kecana tatsvarūpaṃ lokāyatāstvāṃ priyamāmananti // //
analyzed: loka atiśāyi pravilokya lakṣmī balam vilāsa eka phalam viśālam  ānandanam kecana tad svarūpam lokāyatāḥ tvām priyam āmananti
translated: Having seen the vast glory, surpassing the worlds, the fruit of mere sport,🔽Some call that form of yours, which delights, the essence of the world.

original: tataḥ priyaṃ kecana te vyayena lakṣmyāstathā kreyamalaṃ svamūlam /
analyzed: tatas priyam kecana te vyayena lakṣmyāḥ tathā kreyam alam sva mūlam
translated: Then some call you dear, by the expenditure of that wealth, and also by the price of your own root.

original: vilolakhelaṃ kulapāvanaṃ tvāṃ paśyanti nāthaṃ tanayaṃ spṛhābhiḥ // //
analyzed: vilola khelam kula pāvanam tvām paśyanti nātham tanayam spṛhābhiḥ
translated: They see you, the playful, the wandering, the sanctifier of the family, the lord, the son, with desires.

analyzed: vyasteṣu bhūteṣu an avāpyam āpyam sammiśriteṣu pratideva yānam
translated: In the scattered elements, the unobtainable is obtained, in the mixed, the divine path.

analyzed: cit rūpam ānanda samam guḍa ādau tīrthyāḥ guroḥ tvām priyam ādriyante
translated: The form of consciousness, equal to bliss, in molasses etc., the heretics, the guru, honor you, the beloved.

analyzed: an elā mūka ādiṣu duḥkha dṛṣṭyā jñāna kriyā kāraṇa bhāvataḥ ca
translated: In the dumb, the mute, etc., due to the view of suffering, and from the state of cause of knowledge and action,

original: svacchaṃ tato'pi priyamindriyaṃ tvāmindrādivandyaṃ ca vidanti kecit // //
analyzed: svaccham priyam indriyam tvām indra ādi vandyam ca vidanti kecid
translated: Some know you, the pure, the dearer than that, the sense organ, to be worthy of worship by Indra and others.

original: p / vināśanāṃ vāpi pipāsutāṃ vā prāptervimūrchādikavedanānām /
analyzed: vināśanām vā api pipāsu tām vā prāpteḥ vimūrchā ādika vedanānām
translated: Or the desire for destruction, or thirst, or the experience of fainting and other sensations,

analyzed: karma ādi adhiṣṭhātṛ tayā ca sarva prāṇam viduḥ prāṇam iha itare api
translated: And as the overseer of karma and others, others know you as the life-force here.

analyzed: etad jñayā atas priyayā akhila eka nimitta saṅkalpa vikalpa śaktyā
translated: From this, known by the dear one, the sole cause of the power of imagination and deliberation,

analyzed: prakāśayante pratibhāsu citta ākāśa śriyā tvām apare cit īśam
translated: Others illuminate you, the lord of consciousness, in the appearances of the mind, with the glory of the sky of consciousness.
The form of the appearance of knowledge, meaning, function, tolerance, non-discrimination, discrimination, etc.,

original: kṣaṇaṃ kṣaṇaṃ lolamapi smṛtīśaṃ tvāṃ saugatā asmaraṇaṃ smaranti // //
analyzed: kṣaṇam kṣaṇam lolam api smṛti īśam tvām saugatāḥ asmaraṇam smaranti  /
translated: The Saugatas remember you, the lord of memory, as non-memory, though momentarily fickle.

analyzed: bhāvasya sarvasya laya inubhāvyam sattā para jñāna vihīna bhāvam
translated: In the dissolution of all existence, they experience you, who are devoid of the existence of the highest knowledge.

original: śūnyaṃ sadāpūrṇamaho vidanti svavedakaṃ mādhyamikā bhavantam // //
analyzed: śūnyam sadā pūrṇam aho vidanti sva vedakam mādhyamikāḥ bhavantam
translated: The Mādhyamikas always know you as empty yet full, the self-knower.

original: jīvāditattve navadhā vibhakte heyāt samādeyatamaṃ vimuktyai /
analyzed: jīva ādi tattve navadhā vibhakte heyāt samādeyatamam vimuktyai
translated: When the truth of the individual soul and others is divided into nine, you are the most acceptable for liberation, to be accepted from the undesirable.

analyzed: arhantam aṣṭādaśa doṣa hīnam arhanti jaina jña janāḥ bhavantam
translated: The Jaina scholars consider you as the Arhat, free from the eighteen faults.

analyzed: sthūlāt ca kāyāt viṣayi śriyaḥ ca nitāntam udrikta gatim maheśam
translated: From the gross body and the glory of the enjoyer, you are the great Lord with an extremely exalted state.

analyzed: sadā api tad tā parimāṇam ānyam āśā ambarāḥ tvām pradiśanti adhīśam
translated: The people of the sky of hope always point you out as the Lord, whose measure is always beyond that.

analyzed: jñāna ādibhiḥ sva ātma guṇaiḥ viśiṣṭam bhave pavarge tu tat ucchidābhiḥ
translated: You are distinguished by your own qualities such as knowledge, but in existence, they are destroyed by the desire for liberation.

original: śūnyaṃ nimittaṃ paramāṇutantraṃ tvāṃ tārkikā nātha vitarkayanti // //
analyzed: śūnyam nimittam paramāṇu tantram tvām tārkikāḥ nātha vitarkayanti
translated: The logicians consider you as the void, the cause, dependent on the atom, O Lord.

analyzed: sapta artha vitte paritas samāptyā prāptāt avāpyam parama āpta bhāvāt
translated: Having attained the highest perfection through the complete attainment of the knowledge of the seven meanings, from the state of the highest attainment, which is to be obtained.

original: sāmānyameyaṃ ca kaṇādavādā vadanti kartāramimaṃ vibhuṃ tvām // //
analyzed: sāmānya meyam ca kaṇāda vādāḥ vadanti kartāram imam vibhum tvām
translated: The followers of Kaṇāda speak of you as the creator, the all-pervading one, who is the general object of knowledge.

analyzed: pratyeya vijñānam ahaṃpratīteḥ ajñam tathā upādhi tiraskṛta tvāt
translated: You are not known through the knowledge of the object to be known, because of being obscured by limiting adjuncts.

analyzed: vibhinna varga eka vidheya sargam tvām bhāṭṭa vargāḥ mṛgayanti amṛgyam
translated: The Bhaṭṭa school seeks you, the unsearchable one, whose creation is of one kind, different from the class of creation.

analyzed: antar bahis vā pratisarga vṛtteḥ nāśa akṣama tvāt nitarām upādheḥ
translated: Whether internally or externally, due to the impossibility of destroying the upādhi, which is the mode of manifestation in each creation,

analyzed: ahaṃpratīteḥ api vā ajña vṛttyā prābhākarāḥ ajñam udāharanti
translated: The Prābhākaras also cite the ignorant one as the object of the cognition of I, due to the mode of ignorance.

original: jīvādvibhinnaṃ samupāsyamasya saṃjīvanaṃ kāraṇakāryatāyāḥ /🔽patiṃ paśūnāṃ paśupāśanāśaśeṣaṃ viduḥ pāśupatā vata tvām // //🔽p / śrīvāsudevaṃ prakṛtiṃ parāṃ tvāṃ prakāśya jīvāgnikaṇaṃ lasantam /
analyzed: jīvāt vibhinnam samupāsyam asya saṃjīvanam kāraṇa kārya tāyāḥ  patim paśūnām paśu pāśa nāśa śeṣam viduḥ pāśupatāḥ vata tvām  śrī vāsudevam prakṛtim parām tvām prakāśya jīva agni kaṇam lasantam
translated: They know you as the object of his worship, different from the individual soul, the cause of the enlivening of the effect,🔽The Pāśupatas know you as the lord of the individual souls, the destroyer of the bonds of the individual souls, and the remainder.

analyzed: asmāt sva kāryāt itaram ca kecid prapañcayanti añcita pāñcarātrāḥ
translated: Some, with their Pañcarātra doctrine expanded, describe you, Vāsudeva, the supreme Prakṛti, shining as the spark of the individual soul's fire,

original: akleśakarmāśayapākatantraḥ pradhānasattvapratibimbitatvāt /🔽pātañjalīye sakalajña īśaḥ smṛto'si saṃsārivilakṣaṇo'pi // //
analyzed: a kleśa karma āśaya pāka tantraḥ pradhāna sattva pratibimbita tvāt  pātañjalīye sakala jñaḥ īśaḥ smṛtaḥ asi saṃsāri vilakṣaṇaḥ api
translated: As different from this, your own effect, relying on the ripening of the latent impressions of karma without difficulty,🔽In the Pātañjalayoga, you are known as the omniscient lord, different from the transmigrating beings,

analyzed: prakṛti adhīna akhila kāryam anyam tasyāḥ ca tad jñam puruṣam viśiṣṭam
translated: Another one, whose all actions are dependent on Prakṛti, and the Puruṣa, who knows that, is distinguished,

analyzed: asaṃkhya saṃkhyam vitata eka saṃkhyam bhoktāram ākhyāti ca
translated: The enjoyer, described as innumerable, one, and extended, by the Sāṃkhyas.

analyzed: sāṃkhya saṃkhyā
translated: The enumeration of the Sāṃkhya.

analyzed: sarvasya sarva vyavahāra vṛtteḥ śabda artha tā ūtaḥ tad adhīna sṛṣṭeḥ
translated: Of all, of the functioning of all practical affairs, from the meaning of words, therefore dependent on that creation.

analyzed: ādi anta mānaḥ dhvani paṇḍitānām mataḥ dhvaniḥ brahma tayā adhvaniḥ tvam
translated: The beginning and end are considered by the wise in sound to be sound, your nature is Brahman.
By the experience of beginningless ignorance, the state of being an agent and the state of being an effect are all one.

analyzed: śruti anta saṃvādana khela lolāḥ brahma advayam tvā anubhavanti santaḥ
translated: The wise experience you, non-dual Brahman, with the playfulness of the agreement with the end of the Vedas.

analyzed: viśva uttaraḥ viśva karaḥ bala ekaḥ niveśitaḥ asi ātma bale paraiḥ ca
translated: The one who is placed above the universe, the creator of the universe, the one with strength, is established in his own strength and by others.

original: viśvatra viśvena ca viśvaviśvaṃ tvāṃ te vidurviśvamatottarajñāḥ // //
analyzed: viśvatra viśvena ca viśva viśvam tvām te viduḥ viśva mata uttara jñāḥ
translated: Those who know the universe as the highest, they know you, the universe of the universe, the universe of the universe.

analyzed: tad uttaram tad mayam ajña guhyam pūrvam sadā pūrvam imam svatantram
translated: That which is higher than that, full of that, the secret of the ignorant, that which always existed before, this independent one.

analyzed: kecid mahārtha eka nayāḥ prapannāḥ triloka tāloka viloka lokam
translated: Some, having resorted to the one path of great meaning, see the light of the three worlds.
With a great mass of ropes of hope for the hope of the light of inference that is not self-luminous,

analyzed: viśeṣa vaidagdhya juṣam maheśam māheśvarāḥ tvām bhṛśam āviśanti
translated: those who are devoted to Maheśa, who possesses special skill, enter you greatly.

analyzed: mūrdhābhiṣiktam tridaśa adhirājye yajñeśvaram yajña naya eka tarpyam
translated: The one consecrated on the head as the king of the thirty gods, the lord of sacrifices, the sole satiator of the sacrificial rites,

original: varṣādidātāramuśanti kecidaindrā mahendraṃ ca dṛśāṃ nidhiṃ tvām // //
analyzed: varṣa ādi dātāram uśanti kecid aindrāḥ mahendram ca dṛśām nidhim tvām
translated: Some call you Indra, the great Indra, the lord of the gods, the lord of sacrifices, the sole bestower of rain and other blessings, the lord of the eyes, the treasure of the eyes.

analyzed: hutvā āśraya āśam su nirāśraya āśam aśeṣa doṣa pluṣaṇa plavana prakāśam
translated: Having offered the fire-sacrifice, the refuge of the helpless, the light that removes all faults,

original: barhirmukhasvasvamukhaṃ makheṣu tvāṃ tajjanāḥ kecana viśramāya // //
analyzed: barhiḥ mukha sva sva mukham makheṣu tvām tad janāḥ kecana viśramāya
translated: Some people in the world resort to you, the sacrificial fire, the mouth of the gods, for peace.

original: samāsamānāṃ samatākriyāsu kṣamaṃ sameṣāṃ yamināṃ ca sāmyam /
analyzed: sama asamānām sama tā kriyāsu kṣamam sameṣām yaminām ca sāmyam
translated: You are capable of equalizing the unequal, in acts of equality, and of bringing about equality among the equal ascetics.

original: amā nayantaṃ svayame namanti karmāntakaṃ dharmavidaḥ pare tvām // //🔽p / pūrvaṃ nijāṃśaṃ makhato dadhānaṃ paropadeśādrasarājasiddheḥ /
analyzed: amā nayantam svayame namanti karma antakam dharma vidaḥ pare tvām  pūrvam nija aṃśam makhataḥ dadhānam para upadeśāt rasarāja siddheḥ
translated: The knowers of dharma, the followers of the end of action, bow to you, the controller, the destroyer of karma, the self-controlled one.

analyzed: sampūrita āśam śiva paurvadevāḥ tvām pūrvadeva īśvaram āmananti
translated: Some ancient gods consider you as the ancient lord of gods, who first assumed your portion in the sacrifice, and whose desires were fulfilled through the attainment of the king of elixirs by the instruction of others.

analyzed: susāra ratnākara deśanātham jalāśaya āveśita sattvam anye
translated: Others consider you as the lord of the ocean of excellent jewels, the lord of the land, whose essence is immersed in the waters,

analyzed: niyāmakam sattva gaṇasya nityam niyāmayanti appatim īśvaram tvām
translated: The constant controller of the group of beings, the lord of the waters, the controller.

original: tvāṃ prāṇanaṃ prāṇavatāṃ balānāṃ balaṃ vibhaktāntarapañcavṛttim /
analyzed: tvām prāṇanam prāṇavatām balānām balam vibhakta antara pañca vṛttim
translated: You are the life of the living, the strength of the strong, the fivefold manifestation of the differentiated one,

analyzed: anye api anuccheda gatim maheśam abhyāsa siddhi eka nidhim bhajanti
translated: Others also worship Mahesha, the abode of the sole perfection of practice, who has the nature of non-cessation.

analyzed: nidhim nidhīnām vipadām vipatti karam su durdharṣa tṛṣā apakāram
translated: The treasure of treasures, the cause of misfortune for misfortunes, the remover of the torment of thirst that is very difficult to overcome,

original: nīrājayante'khilarājarājaṃ tejovrajaiḥ puṇyajanā bhavantam // //🔽brahmādibījaikavidheyasargaṃ nisargavargaprabhavaṃ bhavādim /
analyzed: nīrājayanta ikhila rājarājam tejaḥ vrajaiḥ puṇya janāḥ bhavantam  brahma ādi bīja eka vidheya sargam nisarga varga prabhavam bhava ādim
translated: The people of virtue pay homage to you, the king of all kings, with multitudes of radiance.

original: brahmeśvaraṃ brahmavidarbhagarbhaṃ tvāṃ brāhmaṇā brahmaṇi bṛṃhayanti //
analyzed: brahma īśvaram brahma vidarbha garbham tvām brāhmaṇāḥ brahmaṇi bṛṃhayanti
translated: The Brahmanas praise you, who are the Brahman, the Lord, the source of the group of creations consisting of Brahma and others, the embryo of the womb of the Brahman.

analyzed: vaikuṇṭha nātham hatakuṇṭha buddhim duṣkarma ṣaṇḍa tva karam param tvām
translated: The Lord of Vaikuntha, whose intellect is destroyed, who causes the mass of evil deeds to be destroyed, who is the supreme one,

analyzed: utkaṇṭhate draṣṭum atīta kaṣṭam keṣāṃcana antar para diṣṭa śiṣṭam
translated: Whose inner self is instructed by the supreme one, longs to see you, who have transcended all difficulties.

analyzed: sat sampradāye sahaje samādhau samāhitāḥ tyakta hita ahita āsthāḥ
translated: Those who are absorbed in meditation, who have given up attachment to what is beneficial and harmful, who are born with the true tradition,

analyzed: nirmukti muktāḥ kam apīnam enam kurvanti sākṣāt sanaka ādayaḥ tvām
translated: The Sanakas and others directly make you, who are free from bondage, the most excellent one.

analyzed: sa aṅgena yogena vikalpaka ākhyam atītya tad pāra samādhi siddham
translated: By means of the yoga with its parts, having transcended the one called vikalpa, which is accomplished by the supreme meditation that is its other shore,

original: prasiddhasiddhyekavinidhiṃ ca siddhā ārādhayantyātmapatiṃ bhavantam // //🔽tvāṃ nādabhaktipravibhāgagamyaṃ jaḍājaḍāntarharaṇaikaramyam /
analyzed: prasiddha siddhi eka vinidhim ca siddhāḥ ārādhayanti ātma patim bhavantam  tvām nāda bhakti pravibhāga gamyam jaḍa a jaḍa antar haraṇa eka ramyam
translated: And the Siddhas, who have attained the well-known accomplishments, worship you, their own Lord, who are the sole abode of accomplishment.🔽You who are to be known through the division of devotion with sound, who are solely delightful in withdrawing the animate and inanimate,

analyzed: agamyam ajña ārta dhiyaḥ guṇaiḥ svaiḥ gandharva rājāḥ abhirāmayanti
translated: The Gandharva kings, who are inaccessible to the ignorant and afflicted minds with their own qualities, delight you.

analyzed: sapta svarān triṣu api mūrcchanābhiḥ grāmeṣu saṃmūrchya muhur muhur tvām
translated: Having repeatedly combined the seven notes in the three modes and the six scales,

original: prasādhya vādyaṃ viditaṃ caturdhā gāyanti geyādiguruṃ hayāsyāḥ // //
analyzed: prasādhya vādyam viditam caturdhā gāyanti geya ādi gurum hayāsyāḥ
translated: The Hayasirsha sages, having accomplished the known four types of music, sing to you, the teacher of the songs and others.

original: p / geyasya vādyasya tathānurūpaṃ layena nānāgatisaṃśrayeṇa /
analyzed: geyasya vādyasya tathā anurūpam layena nānā gati saṃśrayeṇa
translated: In accordance with the music, with the various movements based on the different rhythms,

analyzed: ananya bhāvāḥ sura vāra vadhvaḥ tvām prīṇayanti pratiśakti nātham
translated: The celestial women, who are devoted to no one else, delight you, the Lord of the power of speech.

analyzed: pātrāṇi nānā vidhinā anukṛtya nyakkṛtya śokam hata loka lokyam
translated: Having played the instruments in various ways, having set aside sorrow, having defeated the world and the worldly,

original: alaukikānandaghanaṃ patiṃ tvāṃ bhūtāḥ piśācā api hāsayanti // //
analyzed: alaukika ānanda ghanam patim tvām bhūtāḥ piśācāḥ api hāsayanti
translated: Even the ghosts and goblins make you laugh, you who are the Lord, dense with the bliss of the extraordinary.

analyzed: prati sva yuktam svara maṇḍala ādi aṃḍhyam vādyam su nādaiḥ parivādayantaḥ
translated: Playing the musical instruments with the proper notes, with the circle of notes and so on, with beautiful sounds,

analyzed: bhakti eka vaśyam nija bhakta varyāḥ tvām nārada ādyāḥ api kīrtayanti
translated: Even Narada and others sing thy praises, O Lord, who art wholly subject to devotion, and who art the best of thy devotees.

analyzed: sthitim śritāḥ laṅghita saptasaptim saptarṣayaḥ sāma kathā vidagdhāḥ
translated: The seven sages, skilled in the Saman chants, who have attained the seventh stage of Yoga,

original: tvāṃ sāmabhiḥ saptabhirāptakāmā upāsate sāmajavākyagamyam // //🔽vidyābhirādyābhiranādyavidyāvidaṃ vidhijñāḥ pratividdhasiddhim /
analyzed: tvām sāmabhiḥ saptabhiḥ āpta kāmāḥ upāsate sāma ja vākya gamyam  vidyābhiḥ ādyābhiḥ anādya vidyā vidam vidhi jñāḥ pratividdha siddhim
translated: Meditate upon thee, O Lord, who art to be known by the seven Samans, and whose desires are fulfilled.

analyzed: vidyādhipam vedaka vedya vedyam vidyādharāḥ tvām abhide vidanti  /
translated: The Vidyadharas know thee, O Lord, who art to be known by the Vedas, who art the knower of the Vedas, who art the object of knowledge, who hast attained perfection by the knowledge of the Vedas, and who art the master of the Vedas.

analyzed: siddhāḥ ca sādhyāt atiyāta siddhim asiddha siddhi eka vidām vivedyam
translated: The Siddhas and Sadhyas, who have attained perfection beyond perfection, meditate upon thee, O Lord, who art to be known by those who have attained the perfection of non-perfection, and who art the master of the Sadhyas.

original: samādhaye tvāmasamādhivādhaṃ sādhyā adhīśaṃ vata sādhayanti // //🔽cikitsayā tānamarānapi drāgāpādayantāvagadatvasiddhim /🔽tvāmaśvināvādibhiṣagvareṇyaṃ saṃdhyāyato hṛdyamanādhinātham // //🔽viśveśvaraṃ viśvamatāvabhātaṃ viśvatra viśvena ca vedyamekam /
analyzed: samādhaye tvām asamādhi vādham sādhyāḥ adhīśam vata sādhayanti  cikitsayā tān amarān api drāk āpādayantau agada tva siddhim  tvām aśvinau ādi bhiṣaj vareṇyam saṃdhyāyataḥ hṛdyam anādhinātham  viśveśvaram viśva mata avabhātam viśvatra viśvena ca vedyam ekam
translated: The Sadhyas, who are not hindered by concentration, attain thee, O Lord, by concentration, for the sake of concentration.🔽The Ashvins, by their excellent medical treatment, quickly attain thee, O Lord, who art the best of physicians, who art the master of the heart, and who art free from disease.

original: avedakānyaṃ vidhināpi viśvedevā hṛdi tvāṃ viniveśayanti // //
analyzed: vidhinā api viśvedevāḥ hṛdi tvām viniveśayanti
translated: The Vishvedevas, by their worship, place thee in their hearts, O Lord, who art the master of the universe, who art the light of all religions, who art to be known everywhere by the universe, and who art the only object of knowledge.

original: nirvāsanāvāsitavāsanānāṃ samāsitaṃ nirvasanaṃ svavāse /🔽vasuvrajaistvāṃ vasavo'pi tṛpteḥ santarpayantyekakahetuhetum // //
analyzed: nirvāsana āvāsita vāsanānām samāsitam nirvasanam sva vāse  vasu vrajaiḥ tvām vasavaḥ api tṛpteḥ santarpayanti ekaka hetu hetum
translated: Those whose desires are removed, whose desires are infused with the removal of desires, who are united in their own abode,🔽The Vasus, even though they are satisfied, satisfy you, the single cause of the cause of satisfaction, with a multitude of riches.

original: p / paṭuṃ naṭaṃ ceṭakanāṭakānāṃ māyāṭanaṃ tvāmapi guhyakaughāḥ /
analyzed: paṭum naṭam ceṭaka nāṭakānām māyā aṭanam tvām api guhyaka oghāḥ
translated: You are the skillful dancer and the servant of the dramas, and the multitude of Guhyakas,

original: guhyātiguhyaṃ parito lasantamapi prabhuṃ prāptumupodbalante // //🔽bhaktyā prasādīkṛtamerulaṅkaṃ tvadantike vairakalaṅkaśaṅkāḥ /
analyzed: guhya ati guhyam paritas lasantam api prabhum prāptum upodbalante  / bhaktyā prasādīkṛta meru laṅkam tvad antike vaira kalaṅka śaṅkāḥ
translated: Even though they are shining all around, strive to attain you, the secret of secrets, the lord.🔽The demons, along with the demons, abandoning the fear of the stain of enmity in your presence,

original: suraistyajanto danujā bhajante sarākṣasā dhanyatamaṃ vibhuṃ tvām // //
analyzed: suraiḥ tyajantaḥ danujāḥ bhajante sa rākṣasāḥ dhanyatamam vibhum tvām
translated: Worship you, the most blessed lord, who have been favored by devotion.

analyzed: agaṇya naipuṇya dhana agragaṇyāḥ puṇya āpta sevā graha saṃgraheṇa
translated: The Gaṇas, the foremost of the Gaṇas, with the collection of the foremost service obtained through merit,

original: gaṇā gaṇānāṃ gaṇarājarājaṃ tvāṃ sadguṇā nātha sadā bhaṇanti // //🔽utkīrṇaratnaiḥ sphaṭikopaleṣu citraṃ vicitraṃ vinivedya bhaktyā /
analyzed: gaṇāḥ gaṇānām gaṇa rāja rājam tvām sat guṇāḥ nātha sadā bhaṇanti  utkīrṇa ratnaiḥ sphaṭika upaleṣu citram vicitram vinivedya bhaktyā
translated: Always speak of you, O Lord, the king of the kings of the Gaṇas, as having good qualities.🔽The best of divine artists, Tvaṣṭṛ and others, see you, the one who knows the mechanism of effort, with devotion,

analyzed: paśyanti yatna yantra jñam inam svakīyam tvaṣṭṛ ādayaḥ tvām sura kāru varyāḥ
translated: Having offered various wonderful things made of gems on crystal stones.

analyzed: anugraha apagrahayoḥ janasya saṃgrāhitā āgraham īśa śaktyā
translated: The collection of the people in the favor and disfavor of the Lord, through the power of the Lord's will,

original: tvāmeva kāleśvaramākalayya grahā grahojjhaṃ pathi yānti nityam // //
analyzed: tvām eva kāleśvaram ākalayya grahāḥ graha ujjham pathi yānti nityam
translated: Seeing you alone, O Lord of Time, the planets always move on the path, free from planets.

analyzed: a bīja taru ādi bhavaḥ vikāsī niścandra sūryam kha vane su śūnye
translated: The expanding universe without seeds, etc., in the extremely empty sky without the moon and sun,

analyzed: tvām bhūṣayati ātma patim ca kusuma upakāraḥ
translated: The flower offering, in the form of stars, adorns you and your own lord.

original: divyāśraye kvāpi śilājaleṣu kutrāpi kutrāpi girau tarau vā /
analyzed: divya āśraye kvāpi śilā jaleṣu kutrāpi kutrāpi girau tarau vā
translated: Somewhere in a heavenly abode, in the water of a rock, somewhere, somewhere on a mountain or tree,

analyzed: janaḥ manaḥ trāṇa dam iṣṭadevam tvām prākṛtaḥ api arcati viśva viśvam
translated: Even an ordinary person worships you, the protector of the mind, the desired god, the universe of the universe.

analyzed: nārībhiḥ āliṅgita vāma bhāgā yukta dvi jihvā guṇa gāna śaktyai
translated: You, whose left side is embraced by women, with two tongues for the power of singing qualities,

analyzed: gāyanti śeṣa ādika nāga rājāḥ śeṣa īśvaram tvām kṛta śeṣa śeṣam
translated: The kings of serpents like Shesha sing you, the lord of Shesha, who have completed the remaining tasks.

original: p / tvāṃ rūpavanto'pi ca vāyuvegā nānānisargaiḥ karuraṇairupetāḥ /
analyzed: tvām rūpavantaḥ api ca vāyu vegāḥ nānā nisargaiḥ karu raṇaiḥ upetāḥ
translated: You, who are handsome and have the speed of wind, endowed with various natural qualities,

original: dvidhā gatau dakṣatamāḥ khagānāṃ gaṇāḥ khageśaṃ parivījayanti // //
analyzed: dvidhā gatau dakṣatamāḥ khagānām gaṇāḥ khaga īśam parivījayanti  /
translated: The best of birds, divided into two, fan you, the lord of birds.

original: vane vane saṃśritavanyavṛttiḥ kastūrikādyaiḥ svaguṇaiḥ samiddhaḥ /
analyzed: vane vane saṃśrita vanya vṛttiḥ kastūrikā ādyaiḥ sva guṇaiḥ samiddhaḥ
translated: In every forest, resorting to the conduct of forest dwellers, prosperous with your own qualities like musk,

analyzed: mṛgavrajaḥ tvām namati prasattyai pañcānana īśānam apāsta mānaḥ
translated: The herd of deer bows to you for favor, abandoning pride, the lord of the five-faced one.

analyzed: surāpagāyām vihita abhiṣekam tvām ardha bhogena ca sallakīnām
translated: You who have performed your ablutions in the heavenly river, with half your body the sallaki trees,

analyzed: nija aṅganā burburaka ādi vādyaiḥ santarpayat gāyati hāstikam ca
translated: The elephants, having bathed in the celestial river, and having been gratified with the music of their own female elephants, are singing and dancing.

original: vādānurūpaṃ parinartayantaḥ padakramaṃ svaṃ satataṃ sadaśvāḥ /🔽heṣāviśeṣaiḥ parivāhanāya tvāmāhvayante'pratimaṃ svanātham // //
analyzed: vāda anurūpam parinartayantaḥ pada kramam svam satatam sat aśvāḥ  heṣā viśeṣaiḥ parivāhanāya tvām āhvayante pratimam sva nātham
translated: The excellent horses, always following their own steps in accordance with the music,🔽are neighing with special whinnies to invite you, their incomparable lord, for a ride.

original: tāṃ kaiśavīṃ vṛttimupāsya tiṣṭhañjalāśayeṣu svapatiṃ bhavantam /
analyzed: tām kaiśavīm vṛttim upāsya tiṣṭhan jalāśayeṣu sva patim bhavantam
translated: The group of your female elephants, remaining in the water reservoirs, serving the Kaiśika style, and seeking you, their husband,

analyzed: vāḥ cāra varga upya nivārya caryam itas tatas nviṣyati toṣa hetoḥ  soma īśvaram tvām api kālakūṭam āpādayantam para soma bhāvam
translated: are searching here and there, their conduct unrestrained, for the sake of satisfaction.🔽The group of great herbs is bowing to you, O Lord, who have assumed the form of the poison Kālakūṭa, but are the supreme Soma,

analyzed: sa soma maulim kali kāla hāram mahauṣadhīnām namati īśa saṅghaḥ  /
translated: who have the moon on your head, and who remove the Kali age.

analyzed: sva svāmi bhāva prathitāsu tāsu tāsu īdṛśīṣu pratibhūmikāsu
translated: In those various stages of existence, known as the relationship between the self and the Supreme Self,

analyzed: ayam paraḥ kaḥ api para apara sthaḥ
translated: this Supreme One, who is beyond the relative and the absolute, is playing, playing alone in the play.

analyzed: parātma tantra tva kalā balena vibhāsitāḥ tāḥ khalu bhūmikāḥ te
translated: Those stages, indeed, are manifested by the power of the art of being independent of the Supreme Self.

analyzed: sva ācchādana unmīlana tāratamya prabhedi tā bheda vibheda kartuḥ
translated: The difference is determined by the degree of unfolding of the pure covering.

analyzed: etāvatīm vyāptim upāgataḥ tvam aṃśa aṃśikāyām bhavat icchayā eva
translated: You have attained this much of pervasion by the power of your will alone in the parts and portions.

original: na grāhitā āgrahamalpadṛṣṭiniṣṭhā vidanti svavadaṃ susāram // //
analyzed: na grāhitāḥ āgraham alpa dṛṣṭi niṣṭhāḥ vidanti sva vadam su sāram
translated: Those of limited vision, who have not grasped the essence of their own self, do not know this.
Even in the realm of the body etc., they know the essence of the reflection of the pervasion of the previous subject.

original: vidurvinā te paraśaktipātaṃ na kiñcanākiñcanagāṃ svavittim // //
analyzed: viduḥ vinā te para śaktipātam na kiñcana akiñcana gām sva vittim
translated: Without your grace, they know nothing of their own experience, which is devoid of anything.

analyzed: nīla ādikānām ca sukha ādikānām viśrāntayā antarmukha bodha dehāḥ
translated: The states of blue etc. and pleasure etc., which are the body of internal consciousness,

analyzed: tvad vyaktaye upāyāḥ tava eva tad tad vidi vedakasya  /
translated: are the means for the manifestation of you, for the expansion of you, for the knower of you in each of those.

original: bahirmukha bhāti yadā yadedaṃ rūpaṃ svarūpe ca tadā maheśa /
analyzed: bahirmukha bhāti yadā yadā idam rūpam sva rūpe ca tadā maheśa
translated: O Mahesha, when this form shines externally, then in its own nature,

analyzed: bāhya upasaṃhāraḥ iha antarā api śānta āspada sthānam idam tu abhaktyā
translated: the external withdrawal is also internal, the abode of peace, this is the truth through devotion.

analyzed: sṛṣṭi ādi sammelana hetuḥ eṣā turyā eva tat tat bhidam udvamantī
translated: This is the fourth itself, the cause of the union of creation etc., vomiting forth that and that division,

original: harantyapi prāptabalā kṛśā ca dvidhānubhūtyekapadā sphurantī // //
analyzed: harantī api prāpta balā kṛśā ca dvidhā anubhūti eka padā sphurantī  /
translated: even while taking away, it shines as the single state of the twofold experience, having attained strength, and being weak.

original: svatantratāyāśca yadā cidātmā vyāptiṃ nimajjyaikamayīṃ bhidāyāḥ /🔽ālambate saṅkucitāstadānīṃ tacchaktayo bhānti na tādṛśo'pi // //
analyzed: svatantra tāyāḥ ca yadā cit ātmā vyāptim nimajjya eka mayīm bhidāyāḥ  ālambate saṅkucitāḥ tadānīm tad śaktayaḥ bhānti na tādṛśaḥ api
translated: And when the self-luminous consciousness, having merged into the state of oneness with the all-pervading Lord,🔽Seizes the state of difference, then its powers appear contracted, not even like that.

analyzed: mala āvṛtaḥ saṃsarate tadā eva para īśvaraḥ yam nijayā icchayā eva
translated: Even then, this Supreme Lord, covered by ignorance, wanders in saṃsāra, by His own will.

analyzed: a pūrṇa tā ādeḥ abhimānakasya mantā daridraḥ para śakti lakṣmyā
translated: The thinker, due to the pride of incompleteness and so on, is poor in the wealth of the Supreme Power.

analyzed: tathā api tadvat nija pañcakṛtyam asya ahatam bhāti hi lakṣaṇāya
translated: Nevertheless, His five-fold activity shines unbroken, for the sake of His own characteristics.

analyzed: muhur muhur sṛṣṭi mukha eka hetuḥ ābhāsana ādyam ca vibhāsya bhāsaḥ
translated: Again and again, He is the sole cause of the face of creation, and He, the light of lights, shines.

analyzed: ajñātṛ tāyām para kṛtya lakṣmyāḥ sva śaktibhiḥ mohita tā bhavitvam
translated: In ignorance, due to the wealth of the Supreme Lord's activity, there is delusion by His own powers.

original: tasyāstathonmīlanataḥ sphuṭaṃ ca maheśvaratvaṃ nijamasya nūnam // //
analyzed: tasyāḥ tathā unmīlanataḥ sphuṭam ca maheśvara tvam nijam asya nūnam
translated: By the manifestation of that, His own state of Maheśvara is certainly clear.

analyzed: antar mukham cittam upātta saṃjñam kramāt kramāt cetana bhāva rūḍham

analyzed: tām samādhiṣu hata a samādhayaḥ sannidhau iva vilokayanti aho
translated: Those whose concentration is destroyed in meditation, behold that (goddess) as if present nearby.
The yogis headed by Sanaka, with the delusion of the intellect observing the world destroyed,

analyzed: martyam atra mṛta jīvana ādyayā vidyayā amara kalām api kṣamau
translated: Are able to lead even the divine arts to the state beyond death and life through the knowledge of immortality here.

original: netumastakalikālakalpanāmaśvinau praṇamato raseśvarīm // //🔽viśvato'pi viniveśya saṃvidaṃ viśvanāthadayitāpadorhṛtām /
analyzed: netum asta kali kāla kalpanām aśvinau praṇamataḥ raseśvarīm  viśvatas api viniveśya saṃvidam viśvanātha dayita āpadoḥ hṛtām
translated: I bow to the Lord of Rasas, the Aśvins, and the goddess of immortality.🔽Having placed consciousness everywhere, taken from the abode of the beloved of the Lord of the Universe,

original: viśvanāmakadivaukaso gatā viśvatoṣamadhiviśvapūjitāḥ // //🔽vāsavena vasunāpi vāsite maulivāsimaṇikāntivāsanaiḥ /🔽vāsayanti vasanairadaḥpade cetasīha vasavo'pyavāsane // //
analyzed: viśva nāmaka divaukasaḥ gatāḥ viśva toṣam adhi viśva pūjitāḥ  vāsavena vasunā api vāsite mauli vāsi maṇi kānti vāsanaiḥ  vāsayanti vasanaiḥ adaḥpade cetasi iha vasavaḥ pya vāsane
translated: The dwellers of heaven named Viśva, worshipped by the entire universe, attain universal satisfaction.🔽Even the Vasus, who have been made to dwell by Indra with the radiance of the crest-jewel,🔽Make the Vasus dwell in the abode beyond the sky with their garments, though they are not inclined to dwell.

analyzed: grāma madhyam upanīya mūrcchitaiḥ sa svaraiḥ amara gāthakaiḥ iyam
translated: This (goddess) is sung by the immortal poets, with voices choked with emotion, in the midst of the village,

original: gīyate tadapadānasuprathairnāmabhiḥ pratipadaṃ kṛtārcanaiḥ // //🔽tāṃ vidanti paravidyayādyayā hṛdyayā sahajayānavadyayā /
analyzed: gīyate tad apadāna su prathaiḥ nāmabhiḥ pratipadam kṛta arcanaiḥ  tām vidanti para vidyayā ādyayā hṛdyayā sahajayā anavadyayā
translated: With her names well-known everywhere, worshipped at every step.🔽They know her through the primordial supreme knowledge, the heart, the innate, the faultless,

analyzed: sadyas eva cita gadya padyayā tad dharāḥ rahita jāḍya vedanāḥ
translated: And immediately through the poetry of the mind, free from the feeling of dullness.

analyzed: vāda nādam anu gītam api anu rāga sāgara nirargala uttaram
translated: Following the playing, the singing too, beyond the bounds of the ocean of passion,

original: ādṛtā gatigataṃ tridhā layaṃ toṣayantyamaranartakā imām // //🔽sādhyasiddhakalanātigāminīṃ rādhayat paramaśambhukāminīm /
analyzed: ādṛtāḥ gati gatam tridhā layam toṣayanti amara nartakāḥ imām  sādhya siddha kalanā ati gāminīm rādhayat parama śambhu kāminīm
translated: With respect, the three-fold rhythm, these divine dancers delight this one.🔽Surpassing the conception of the accomplished and the unaccomplished, delighting the most auspicious one,

analyzed: sādhya yūtham abhisādhayati adaḥ vedanāya hṛdaye su saṃvidam
translated: She accomplishes the group of the to-be-accomplished, placing the excellent knowledge in the heart for the sake of the experience of the accomplished.
Wielding the playfulness of the group of the accomplished, the accomplishment of the accomplished, transcending accomplishment and non-accomplishment, the accomplisher of accomplishment,

original: siddhasaṅgha upadhāvituṃ vidaṃ tāmimāṃ prayatate samādhiṣu // //🔽apsarobhiraniśaṃ rasāpsaromūrtibhirlalitalāsyanarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: siddha saṅghaḥ upadhāvitum vidam tām imām prayatate samādhiṣu  apsarobhiḥ aniśam rasa apsaraḥ mūrtibhiḥ lalita lāsya narmabhiḥ
translated: The assembly of the accomplished strives to approach this one in the meditative absorptions.🔽By the celestial nymphs, always in the form of the celestial nymphs, with the playfulness of the graceful dance,

analyzed: hāva bhāva caturābhiḥ īśvarī toṣyate api rasarāja rājitā
translated: The goddess is delighted, even by those skilled in the expressions of sentiment, adorned with the king of sentiments.

analyzed: guhya guhya viṣayām viśeṣaṇaiḥ gūhita prakṛta cintana ādṛtām
translated: The domain of the secret, guarded by the epithets, devoted to the contemplation of the hidden nature,

analyzed: guhyakāḥ api nigūhayanti tām hṛd guhā gahana geha koṭare
translated: Even the Guhyakas conceal her in the innermost chamber of the cave of the heart.

analyzed: yakṣa kardama vilepanāt iva kālikām akhila kāla kālikām
translated: Like the application of Yaksha ointment, the all-pervading Kali, the destroyer of all times,

original: yakṣakāḥ sakalarakṣikāmimāṃ rakṣayanti hṛdaye sadā smṛteḥ // //
analyzed: yakṣakāḥ sakala rakṣikām imām rakṣayanti hṛdaye sadā smṛteḥ
translated: The Yakshas always protect this one, the protector of all, when remembered in the heart.

analyzed: bhūta bhūti vibhavām bhava abhavām bhūta bhavya bhavat udbhida abhidam
translated: The one who creates the prosperity of the past and future, who is beyond existence and non-existence, who is proclaimed by the one who arises from the past, present and future,

analyzed: bhūtanāyaka vibhūtim īśvarīm bhūta yūtham iha bhāvayati amūm
translated: The one who is the prosperity of the lord of beings, the goddess, the one who nourishes this multitude of beings.

analyzed: bodha tarjita jagat piśācikām yācamāna jana yācana apahām
translated: The one who frightens the demon of the world with enlightenment, who removes the requests of those who beg,

original: añcayanti vicite piśācakrāstāṃ svacetasi citaṃ kathañcana // //
analyzed: añcayanti vicite piśāca krāḥ tām sva cetasi citam kathañcana
translated: The multitude of demons always think of that consciousness in their own mind in some way.

analyzed: nirguṇām guṇa gaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛtām gauṇa tā atiga gaṇa adhipāḥ gaṇāḥ
translated: The multitude of gods, who have gone beyond the multitude of secondary lords, who are adorned with multitudes of qualities,

analyzed: gauṇa tad para kṛta prathā yutaiḥ tām sadā eva gaṇayanti nāmabhiḥ
translated: Always consider that goddess, who is devoid of qualities, with names that are full of fame created by others.

original: tāṃ dhruveṇa paricintayan dhruvāṃ sudhruve pathi gato'pi nirdravaḥ /
analyzed: tām dhruveṇa paricintayan dhruvām su dhruve pathi gataḥ api nirdravaḥ
translated: Thinking of that stable one as stable, he went on the path of Sudhrav, but was without wealth.

original: nirdhruvaṃ jagadidaṃ vilokayan kiṃ dhruvatvamagamanna sa dhruvaḥ // //🔽sāmabhirvimalanāmanāmitairvāmakāmadamanāḥ svakāmadām /
analyzed: nirdhruvam jagat idam vilokayan kim dhruva tvam agamat na sa dhruvaḥ  / sāmabhiḥ vimala nāma nāmitaiḥ vāma kāma damanāḥ sva kāma dām
translated: Looking at this unstable world, did he not attain stability, that stable one?🔽The seven sages, who satisfy their own desires with the pure-named Sama hymns, who go to the desired abode,

analyzed: kāmya dhāma gamanāḥ samāgamām rāmayanti munayaḥ api sapta tām
translated: Delight that one, who is the fulfillment of their desires, who is the one to be approached.

analyzed: nigrahe api jagatām anugrahe tām gṛhīta vihita grahāḥ grahāḥ
translated: The planets, who have taken up the right grasp, even in restraining the world, in favoring it,

original: vigrahe pathi cidātmavigrahāṃ grāhayanti ca navaṃ navaṃ navam // //
analyzed: vigrahe pathi cit ātma vigrahām grāhayanti ca navam navam navam
translated: In the path of dispute, they repeatedly make her, who has the form of the self-existent, take on a new and new form.

original: tāṃ śanaiścara imāṃ śanaiḥ śanairdūṣaṇena vikalaiḥ subhūṣaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tām śanaiścaraḥ imām śanais śanais dūṣaṇena vikalaiḥ subhūṣaṇaiḥ
translated: Slowly, slowly, he adorns her with ornaments that are incomplete due to defects,

analyzed: darśanaiḥ abhicinoti cetasā prāpta loka para loka darśanaiḥ
translated: With thoughts that are adorned with the vision of this world and the next world.
The leader of the gods, who was deceived by the gods in the past and was disappointed by the scriptures,

original: gauravaṃ guruṣu gūrayan gurustāṃ gṛṇāti trijagadguruṃ gurum // //🔽maṅgalo galitagālyamaṅgalo maṅgale prathamapūjyatāmitaḥ /
analyzed: gauravam guruṣu gūrayan guruḥ tām gṛṇāti trijagat gurum gurum
translated: Honoring the guru among the gurus, he praises that guru, the guru of the three worlds.🔽The auspicious one, the inauspicious one, the auspicious one, from here the first to be worshipped,

analyzed: pūjayati udita sarva maṅgala amaṅga lagna śiva sarva maṅgalām  bhāskaraḥ ca nija loka bhāsitaḥ bhāsita akhila jagat trayīm śivām  bhāsayan mukuṭa bhāsibhiḥ pade ratna rāśibhiḥ imām bhajati aram
translated: He worships her, the one who has arisen with all auspicious things, the one whose auspiciousness is attached to all auspicious things.🔽And the sun, illuminated by its own world, illuminates the three auspicious worlds,🔽Illuminating this world with heaps of jewels that shine in the crown, he easily worships it.

analyzed: kāvya kauśala kalā kṛt ekalaḥ śrauta mārga paridhāna cāturīm
translated: The poet, who is the only one skilled in the art of poetry, who has resorted to the skill of adorning the path of hearing,

analyzed: āśritaḥ parama śakti sakta dhīḥ tām kaviḥ ca kavayati anargalam
translated: Whose mind is attached to the supreme power, he composes poetry without obstruction.

original: saumya eva guṇato'pi sarvadā na grahā iva śubhādi bhāvayan /
analyzed: saumyaḥ eva guṇataḥ api sarvadā na grahāḥ iva śubha ādi bhāvayan
translated: He is always gentle even in his qualities, not like the planets promoting good and evil.

original: nirṇayena sa budho'ta udbudhāṃ saumya īśvaritamāṃ bhajatyalam // //🔽p / candramā avirataṃ sudhābhṛtāṃ candrikāṃ pathi pathi prasārayan /🔽arcati prabhumudāravibhramāmutpalaiḥ svayamimāṃ vikāsitaiḥ // //

translated: That wise one, therefore, is fully devoted to the gentle Lord, the most powerful.🔽The moon, constantly spreading its nectar-bearing moonlight on every path,🔽worships the expansive-minded Goddess with these blooming blue lotuses.

analyzed: svargabhānuḥ api puccha mūrcchitaḥ vyāpta bhānum iha bhāvayati amūm  /
translated: The moon, which is censured by the hot-rayed sun and the cold-rayed moon, and which removes the pride of other lords,🔽the moon that has risen in the sky, worships this all-pervading Goddess.

analyzed: kumbhasambhava muniḥ sudakṣiṇaḥ dakṣiṇām diśam upāśritaḥ sthiram
translated: The sage born from a pot, very skillful, has firmly resorted to the southern direction.

original: dakṣamanyudamanīmaṇīyasā cetasā smarati bodhadakṣiṇām // //🔽puṇyakarmacitanāmadhāmabhiḥ sadguṇaiḥ surabhimeva nirguṇām /
analyzed: dakṣa manyu damanī maṇīyasā cetasā smarati bodha dakṣiṇām  puṇya karma cita nāma dhāmabhiḥ sat guṇaiḥ surabhim eva nirguṇām
translated: With a mind that is very small in subduing the anger of Daksha, he remembers the one who is skillful in bestowing knowledge.🔽The sky-goers, who are devoid of good qualities, worship her, who is fragrant with the abode of meritorious deeds, who is devoid of qualities,

analyzed: antarikṣa gajanāḥ namanti tām saṃjñayā surabhi loka mukhyayā
translated: with the chief name of Surabhi, the world of fragrance.

analyzed: vāyu vega gatayaḥ api khecarāḥ sva svabhāva paribhāvukām imām
translated: The sky-walkers, who move with the speed of wind, who desire to contemplate on their own nature,

analyzed: bījayanti nija pakṣa sañcayaiḥ khecara īśvaritamām su cāmaraiḥ
translated: And the lords of the sky, with their flocks of birds, fan me with excellent yak-tail whisks.

analyzed: mānavāḥ ca bhuvi sattva māninaḥ mānanīya mahasam manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: And the wise men on earth, who pride themselves on their goodness, honor the one who is to be honored, the great goddess.

original: tāṃ namanti pṛthagāttamānadāṃ kutra kutra ca nijeṣṭadevatām // //🔽bhūdhṛtatvaviditāśca bhūtale śeṣamukhyajanatā janeśvarīm /
analyzed: tām namanti pṛthak ātta mānadām kutra kutra ca nija iṣṭadevatām  bhū dhṛta tva viditāḥ ca bhū tale śeṣa mukhya janatāḥ janeśvarīm
translated: They bow to her, who grants the highest good to each, and who is their own chosen deity.🔽And the people on earth, who are known for their support of the earth, headed by Sesha,

analyzed: saṃgṛṇanti vinimeṣa darśanāḥ śeṣa śeṣa viṣayām viśeṣaṇaiḥ  ittham atra parameśvarīm imām prāṇinaḥ parama bhakti saktayaḥ
translated: Sing about the queen of the people, the one who is the remainder of all that remains, with eyes that never close, using distinguishing features.🔽Thus, the living beings here, with great devotion,

analyzed: pūjayanti japa homa tarpaṇaiḥ bhūri tantra vihitaiḥ hitaiḥ tataiḥ
translated: Worship this supreme goddess with prayers, oblations, and offerings, using the beneficial rituals prescribed by the scriptures.

analyzed: stotra rājam imam ākalayya sā loka lakṣaṇa vilakṣaṇam mayā
translated: Having heard this king of hymns, which is unlike any other in the world, composed by me,

analyzed: spaṣṭam āśu vihitam guru kramāt āviveśa kila mām mudam gatā  /
translated: It is said that it brought me great joy, having entered me clearly and quickly through the guru's instructions.

analyzed: tad prabhṛti anavamam kṣamam samam prāptam īśvaratara āspadam mayā
translated: From that time on, I have attained the incomparable state of the supreme lord, which is beyond the eighth and ninth.

analyzed: yena kartum api hartum anyathā kartum etat akhilam kṣamaḥ asmi aho
translated: By which I am able to create, destroy, and transform this entire universe, alas!

analyzed: saḥ ham asmi aṇuḥ aṇīyasām mahān jyāyasām api garīyasām guruḥ
translated: I am the smallest of the small, the greatest of the great, the hardest of the hard, the most subtle of the subtle.
