analyzed: prāṇataḥ api ca laghuḥ sthavīyasām su sthiraḥ sakala kāmya kāma daḥ
translated: I am the smallest of the small, the greatest of the great, the heaviest of the heavy, the lightest of the light, the most stable of the stable, and the fulfiller of all desires.

analyzed: īśitā asmi vaśitā abhyalaṅkṛtaḥ prāpta gamya pada dāna dakṣiṇaḥ
translated: I am the lord, adorned with mastery, skilled in granting the attainable and unattainable.

analyzed: sarvam ātma kalayā vibhāvayan bhāvam eṣa bhavaḥ udbhava abhavaḥ
translated: Contemplating everything with the essence of the Self, this existence is free from origin and destruction.

analyzed: saccid advaya sukha ūrmi dharmavān ūrmi mukta mahimā svatantrayā
translated: Possessing the dharma of the waves of existence, consciousness, non-duality, and bliss, liberated from waves, independent,

analyzed: etayā unmiṣita sammukhīnayā tat tat abhyaracayam carācaram
translated: By the manifestation of these two, I have created this moving and unmoving world.

analyzed: bindum āvis upakṛtya bījataḥ saṅgamayya tat idam punar dvayam
translated: Having created the point from the seed, and uniting these two again,

analyzed: rekhayā akhila puṭa tri saṃjñayā varṇa śabda pada vākya tā tatas
translated: By the line known as the three cavities of all, then the state of letters, words, and sentences arose.

analyzed: tad samūham adhikṛtya su smṛtam tāni tāni aracayam sudarśanaḥ
translated: Having considered that collection, Sudarshana created those various forms.

original: darśanāni hatadṛśyadṛktayā śabdasarga iti nirmito mayā // //
analyzed: darśanāni hata dṛśya dṛś tayā śabda sargaḥ iti nirmitaḥ mayā
translated: The various forms of seeing, with the vision of the destroyed object, were created by me as the creation of sound.

analyzed: unmimeṣa para śaktiḥ āditas tat sadāśivaḥ itas sva vidyayā
translated: The supreme power first manifested from this, Sadasiva, through its own knowledge.

analyzed: īśvara tvam agamat tridhā dyutim tat sva śakti vivṛtam tri kṛtya kṛt
translated: He attained lordship, with threefold radiance, performing the three functions revealed by His own power.

analyzed: māyayā niyati kāla rāgi tā tad kalā kalitayā api vidyayā
translated: By Maya, by Niyati, Kala, Raga, and by Vidyā modified by those Kalas,

original: kañcukairiva vṛtaḥ sa pauruṣīmāgataḥ prakṛtimutkṛtāṃ guṇaiḥ // //
analyzed: kañcukaiḥ iva vṛtaḥ sa pauruṣīm āgataḥ prakṛtim utkṛtām guṇaiḥ
translated: He, as if covered by sheaths, has attained the exalted Prakṛti through Pūrusa, endowed with qualities.

original: khyāta eṣa kila jīvasaṃjñayā cittabuddhihṛdahaṃkṛtaiḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: khyātaḥ eṣa kila jīva saṃjñayā citta buddhi hṛd ahaṃkṛtaiḥ kriyāḥ
translated: This one is indeed known by the name Jiva, performing the internal actions through the mind, intellect, heart, and ego,

analyzed: āntarīḥ viracayan bahis tathā śabdita ādi guṇibhiḥ daśa indriyaiḥ
translated: And externally through the ten sense organs beginning with sound.

original: tadguṇebhya udabhūd vibhūtaye pañcabhūtakalanā tato jagat /
analyzed: tad guṇebhyaḥ udabhūt vibhūtaye pañca bhūta kalanā tatas jagat
translated: From His qualities arose the five elemental evolutes for manifestation, from which the world originated.

analyzed: ākarāḥ api jarāyu maulayaḥ tatra bhānti pṛthak īśvara icchayā
translated: Even the sources, such as the womb and the head, shine there separately by the will of the Lord.

original: taccaturdaśavidhaṃ caturdaśairāvṛtaṃ bhuvanarāśibhiḥ pṛthak /🔽bhūtayūthamabhibhāti bhāsito'pyarthasarga iti śaktito mayā // //
analyzed: tat caturdaśavidham caturdaśaiḥ āvṛtam bhuvana rāśibhiḥ pṛthak  bhūta yūtham abhibhāti bhāsitaḥ upi artha sargaḥ iti śaktitaḥ mayā
translated: And that is surrounded by the fourteen worlds, each separately, by the fourteen.🔽The group of elements shines, illuminated, as the creation of objects. This is narrated by me according to my ability.

analyzed: tām imām samavalambya nirmitam viśvam ittham ati gahvaram mayā
translated: Relying on this, I have thus created this extremely profound universe.

original: vedmi tāṃ sakalakāraṇaṃ śivāṃ pūjayāmi ca japāmi bhāvayan // //
analyzed: vedmi tām sakala kāraṇam śivām pūjayāmi ca japāmi bhāvayan
translated: I know that Śivā, the cause of all, and worship and meditate on Her with devotion.

analyzed: nandikeśvara parāparām imām śaktim eva mad anugraha āspadam
translated: O Nandikeśvara, I bow to that power, which is both supreme and inferior, and which is the abode of my grace,

original: ākhyayācitasahasrasaṃkhyayā stotratāṃ gamitayābhinaumi tām // //🔽ityudīrya virataṃ maheśvaraṃ taṃ carācaraguruṃ vibhuṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: ākhyayā ācita sahasra saṃkhyayā stotra tām gamitayā abhinaumi tām  iti udīrya viratam maheśvaram tam carācara gurum vibhum punar
translated: Having been requested by you, I have made it into a hymn with a thousand names.🔽Having spoken thus, when Maheśvara, the lord of the moving and unmoving, had ceased,

original: sa praṇamya śirasā kṛtāñjalirnandikeśvara uvāca vākpatiḥ // //
analyzed: sa praṇamya śirasā kṛtāñjaliḥ nandikeśvaraḥ uvāca vākpatiḥ
translated: Nandikeśvara, the lord of speech, bowed his head and with folded hands, spoke again.

original: devadeva parameśa śaṅkara lokanātha bhagavan namo'stu te /
analyzed: devadeva parameśa śaṅkara lokanātha bhagavan namaḥ astu te
translated: O Lord of gods, supreme lord Śaṅkara, lord of the world, blessed one, salutations to you.

analyzed: dāsa dāsa padavīm gate mayi saṃprasīda bhavat eka saṃśraye
translated: Having attained the state of a servant of a servant in me, be pleased, O sole refuge of existence.

original: no vidherna nṛharerharerna vā netarasya ca kadāpi kutracit /
analyzed: naḥ vidheḥ na nṛhareḥ hareḥ na vā na itarasya ca kadāpi kutracid
translated: I have never been honored by Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Śiva, or anyone else, anywhere.

analyzed: ādṛtaḥ asmi śaraṇam tvad ekaka prīti bhaktiḥ iti dhārṣṭyam ārabhe
translated: I take this liberty, thinking that you are pleased with my devotion.

analyzed: kṣamyatām idam udīryatām ca tat stotram etat amara īśa durlabham
translated: Let this hymn, difficult to obtain even for the lord of the immortals, be forgiven and spoken.

analyzed: na adya yāvat adhika āmitam mayā na arthana ādiḥ aphalatvam arhati
translated: As long as I have not attained the highest, my request and so on cannot be fruitless.

original: yadyapi prabhurahasyamadbhutaṃ śrotumicchati mano hi māmakam /
analyzed: yadi api prabhu rahasyam adbhutam śrotum icchati manaḥ hi māmakam
translated: Although I am the lord of this secret and wonderful thing, my mind desires to hear it.

original: yadyavācyamapi tattathāpi me vācyameva dayayā dayāśrayaiḥ // //
analyzed: yadi avācyam api tat tathā api me vācyam eva dayayā dayā āśrayaiḥ
translated: If it is inexpressible, still it is expressible to me by the compassionate ones out of compassion.

original: ced vadanti vibhavo na guhyatāṃ yātametadapi tat kva yāmyaho /
analyzed: ced vadanti vibhavaḥ na guhyatām yātam etat api tat kva yāmi aho
translated: If they say, Let not this wealth be kept secret, where shall I go, alas!

analyzed: janma yāvat abhirādhayan śivam rādhanā hi para siddhi sādhanī
translated: As long as birth is to be pleased, for pleasing is the means of attaining the highest success.

analyzed: vāditā guru varaiḥ maheśvaraiḥ nā arhati iti yadi nītiḥ asti api
translated: If there is a rule that what is said by the best teachers, the great lords, is not worthy,

original: tāṃ carettadapi tattvamapyanu hyanyathā bhavati nirṇayaḥ kutaḥ // //
analyzed: tām caret tat api tattvam api anu hi anyathā bhavati nirṇayaḥ kutas
translated: One should follow that, for even that is the truth. Otherwise, how can there be a decision?

original: tad vidhāya karuṇāmanuttarāṃ preṣyabhāvamapi me vicintya tam /
analyzed: tat vidhāya karuṇām anuttarām preṣya bhāvam api me vicintya tam
translated: Having shown that unsurpassed compassion, considering also my state of being a servant,

original: svāmitāmapi nijāṃ staveśvaraṃ vaktumarhasi vibho prabhāviṇam // //
analyzed: svāmi tām api nijām stava īśvaram vaktum arhasi vibho prabhāviṇam
translated: You should speak, O Lord, to praise the powerful Lord, who is also your own master.

original: bhairavaṃ vapuravekṣya te'pyaho praśna eṣa viṣaye pare muhuḥ /
analyzed: bhairavam vapuḥ avekṣya te pi aho praśnaḥ eṣa viṣaye pare muhur
translated: Even they, not seeing your Bhairava form, again and again ask this question about the supreme reality,

original: yadvidhīyata idaṃ na yujyate hyuttamāya vijayo mṛtiḥ same // //
analyzed: yat vidhīyate idam na yujyate hi uttamāya vijayaḥ mṛtiḥ same  /
translated: Which is not proper. For victory and death are the same for the best.

original: prāgapi pratimuhuḥ prabhusmṛterutkamāsasta mama tatra mānasam /
analyzed: prāk api pratimuhur prabhu smṛteḥ utkam āsasta mama tatra mānasam
translated: Even before, my mind was always uplifted there, remembering the Lord again and again.

original: adya tu śrutamahānubhāvato bhūya eva paritaḥ samunmiṣat // //
analyzed: adya tu śruta mahā anubhāvataḥ bhūyas eva paritas samunmiṣat  /
translated: But now, having heard of your greatness, it has become even more expansive all around.

original: p / yat kumāragaṇapādimairapi na śrutaṃ suravaraistadeva cet /
analyzed: yat kumāra gaṇapa ādimaiḥ api na śrutam sura varaiḥ tat eva ced
translated: If that which has not been heard even by the Kumara Gaṇa and the excellent gods, is being spoken to me,

original: procyate mayi mama prasiddhatāṃ yāti bhaktirapi te dayā tadā // //
analyzed: procyate mayi mama prasiddha tām yāti bhaktiḥ api te dayā tadā
translated: then my devotion to you also attains fame. Then have mercy on me.

original: kevalaṃ na mayi te dayāpyasau kintu bhaktajanatāmapi prati /
analyzed: kevalam na mayi te dayā api asau kintu bhakta janatām api prati
translated: Not only is that mercy of yours on me, but also on the multitude of devotees.

original: tvanmukhodgatamimaṃ vicintya yat ko na nauti navarājamadbhutam // //
analyzed: tvad mukha udgatam imam vicintya yat kaḥ na nauti navarājam adbhutam
translated: Having thought about this wonderful new king that has arisen from your mouth, who does not rejoice?

analyzed: vedyate hi vibhu cittam api amum netum udgatam iha prasiddha tām
translated: This one is known to be the all-pervading mind, brought here to attain fame.

original: adya yāvadapi yanna vānyathā pṛṣṭamadya tu kathaṃ na pṛcchyatām // //
analyzed: adya yāvat api yat na vā anyathā pṛṣṭam adya tu katham na pṛcchyatām
translated: Even today, it is not otherwise. But why is it not asked today?

analyzed: ittham etat akhilam vivicyatām procyatām ca navarāj anuttaraḥ
translated: Having thus examined all this, let the new king's reply be spoken.

original: yanna deyamapi tad dayādhanairdīyate kimu na pādasevine // //
analyzed: yat na deyam api tat dayā dhanaiḥ dīyate kimu na pāda sevine
translated: Even that which should not be given, is given by the wealthy ones out of compassion. Then why not to the servant of the feet?

analyzed: ittham asya vacanaiḥ prabhu prabhuḥ nirvṛtaḥ sa vinayaiḥ naya sthiraiḥ
translated: Thus, the lord of lords was delighted by his words, which were respectful, humble, and firm in policy.

original: yogyatāmapi vivicya sacchrutau smāha kiṃ na sulabhaṃ sadāśrayāt // //
analyzed: yogyatām api vivicya sat śrutau sma āha kim na sulabham sat āśrayāt
translated: Having examined his worthiness, he said to the good listener, What is not easily obtained from the support of the Supreme Being?

original: nandikeśvara purāpyabhūd bhavān dvārago rahasi dṛṣṭadiṣṭavān /
analyzed: nandikeśvara purā api abhūt bhavān dvāragaḥ rahasi dṛṣṭa diṣṭavān
translated: O Nandikeśvara, you were in the past also the doorkeeper, seen by the Lord in secret,

analyzed: tad phalam pariṇatam tu idam matiḥ yat
translated: That fruit has ripened into this intellect which is engaged in the specific object.

original: nānuyoktumabhavan kṣamāḥ pare ke'pyadaḥ stavavaraṃ varasthiram /
analyzed: na anuyoktum abhavan kṣamāḥ pare ke pi adaḥ stava varam vara sthiram
translated: Others were not able to argue, but some have uttered this excellent praise, O best of the stable ones.

analyzed: kaiḥ api idam anuyuktam īritam naḥ mayā api samaya prathā vidā
translated: This has been said by some who have been questioned, not by me, who knows the conventions.

analyzed: tvam tu kevalam ananya saṃśrayaḥ tyakta sarva kalanaḥ ca mām prati
translated: But you, who have no other support, who have abandoned all conceptualization, in relation to me,

original: janma yāvadadhikādhikaṃ bhajan pātratāmata ito'si tacchrutau // //
analyzed: janma yāvat adhika adhikam bhajan pātra tām atas itas asi tad śrutau
translated: worshipping more and more until birth, you are now a worthy recipient for this hearing.

analyzed: pūrvam eva tapasā asmi toṣitaḥ divya varṣa sukṛtena bhūyasā
translated: I was already satisfied by your austerities, and even more so by your divine and virtuous conduct for many years.

original: tatphalaṃ hi tava hastagaṃ yato dvārago'si satataṃ rahasyapi // //
analyzed: tat phalam hi tava hasta gam yatas dvāra gā usi satatam rahasi api
translated: For that fruit is in your hand, since you are always the door-keeper, even in secret.

original: īhate na kataraḥ paraḥ surastatpadaṃ tvayi hi yatparaṃ sthiram /
analyzed: īhate na kataraḥ paraḥ suraḥ tat padam tvayi hi yat param sthiram
translated: No other god strives for that supreme state in you, for it is firmly established in you.

original: kaḥ śive prayatate na vā nije kasya cittavidhireti pūrṇatām // //
analyzed: kaḥ śive prayatate na vā nije kasya citta vidhiḥ eti pūrṇa tām
translated: Who strives for Shiva, or for his own self? Whose mind reaches perfection?

analyzed: tad pada sthiti phalam tu idam tava paprathe yat anuyogam ācaraḥ
translated: This is the fruit of your state in that supreme state, which you have attained by questioning.

original: kutracit susamaye'tra me'pi yad vāci ghūrṇitamaterivādaraḥ // //
analyzed: kutracid su samayā itra me api yat vāci ghūrṇita mateḥ iva ādaraḥ
translated: Or, in some suitable place, even in my own mind, which seems to be wavering in speech, there is respect.

original: p / satyameva niyato'si matpriyaḥ sarvato'pi paripṛṣṭa eva yat /
analyzed: satyam eva niyataḥ asi mad priyaḥ paripṛṣṭaḥ eva yat
translated: O Lord, it is true that you are indeed devoted to me, as you have been asked about everything.

analyzed: matta vat param aram stava īśvaram svāti guhyam api bāhyam ācaram  /
translated: You have revealed even your most secret self to me, as if you were intoxicated.

original: adya yāvadabhavo bahirbhave kevalaṃ rahasi me'dhikāravān /
analyzed: adya yāvat abhavaḥ bahis bhave kevalam rahasi medhi kāravān
translated: From today onwards, you may go out, but you have authority only in private.

analyzed: adya tu kopī aho
translated: But now, even in the midst of others, you are someone with great dignity, as your words have been heard.

original: yātyatīva vivṛtaṃ mayā hyadaḥ stotramatra kimu na prasiddhatām /
analyzed: yāti atīva vivṛtam mayā hi adaḥ stotram atra kimu na prasiddha tām
translated: The praise I have uttered has become very well-known, is it not?

original: tatra vṛttamapi te sadāhvayaṃ ko na nauti sakalopakārakam // //
analyzed: tatra vṛttam api te sat āhvayam kaḥ na nauti sakala upakārakam
translated: There, even your secret name is praised by all who benefit.

analyzed: nandikeśvara tat ittham udgatam stotra rājam imam adbhutam śṛṇu
translated: O Nandikeśvara, listen to this wonderful king of praises spoken thus.

original: taṃ niśamya tadanugrahārthiṣu tvaṃ tathā prathaya mad yathādhyagāḥ // //
analyzed: tam niśamya tad anugraha arthiṣu tvam tathā prathaya mat yathā adhyagāḥ
translated: Having heard it, spread it as you have understood it to those who seek your grace.

analyzed: stotra rāj ayam anuttara uttaraḥ nāmabhiḥ daśa śataiḥ su kāma daḥ
translated: This king of praises, named Anuttarottara, with a thousand names, grants all that is desired.

original: smārya eṣa parijapya eṣa vā pāṭhya eṣa havanīya eṣa ca // //
analyzed: smāryaḥ eṣa parijapyaḥ eṣa vā pāṭhyaḥ eṣa havanīyaḥ eṣa ca  /
translated: It should be remembered, recited, read, and offered oblations to.

analyzed: dhyāna pāṭha japa homa tarpaṇaiḥ saḥ usya siddhi nivahaḥ na dūratas
translated: By meditation, recitation, japa, oblation, and offering, the multitude of accomplishments is not far away.

analyzed: durga yoga padavīm parām api yaḥ prayātuḥ api labdhi saṃśaye
translated: Even for one who has set out on the path of the highest yoga of Durga, there is doubt in attaining it.

analyzed: yat prayāta kalanaḥ svam īśvaram prākṛtaḥ api avamata anya saṃkathaḥ
translated: He who, even though an ordinary person, having set out on the path of that (goddess), considers himself the lord, and disregards the talk of others,

original: manyate dvividha eṣa so'dhyayādasya bhoganivahaḥ kiyāniva // //
analyzed: manyate dvividhaḥ eṣa bhoga nivahaḥ kiyān iva
translated: Thinks that this multitude of enjoyments is indeed very little, having studied this (goddess) in two ways.

original: kintu yadgata ito nivartate naiva bhūya iha vāsti yanmayaḥ /
analyzed: kintu yad gataḥ itas nivartate na eva bhūyas iha vā asti yad mayaḥ
translated: But he who has gone from here and does not return, who is not made of this (world),

analyzed: sā api mokṣa vivṛtiḥ suharṣa bhūḥ adhyaya ādika vaśa avaśā bhavet
translated: Even that liberation, which is a great ground of joy, would be under the control of the study etc. of this (goddess).

analyzed: vidhāya śuddhim trividhām pratiṣṭhām api prayukta uttama jīva ghoṣaḥ
translated: Having performed the three kinds of purification, and having applied the excellent sound of life,

original: nyāsaikyabhūṣaḥ smṛtimāṃstrikālaṃ paṭhedimaṃ pratyayataḥ prage vā // //
analyzed: nyāsa aikya bhūṣaḥ smṛtimān tri kālam paṭhet imam pratyayataḥ prage vā
translated: Adorned with the unity of renunciation, mindful of the three times, one should recite this with faith, either in the morning or at the proper time.

analyzed: etat stotram śrutim adhigatam smārya rūpam smṛtīnām
translated: This hymn, which is heard and remembered in the form of the Smritis,

analyzed: dṛṣṭīnām ca prathama viṣayam jyotiṣām jyotiḥ ekam
translated: The first object of the eyes, the light of all lights,

analyzed: sāhityānām gata mati rasa uddhāra tām ādi śakteḥ
translated: Having gone to the essence of the primordial power of the Sahityas,

original: pūjaṃ pūjaṃ praṇamati na kaḥ sārasarvasvabhūtam // //
analyzed: pūjam pūjam praṇamati na kaḥ sāra sarva sva bhūtam
translated: Which wise person does not bow down to this hymn, which is the essence of all that is essential?
Having arisen by the grace of the power of one's own freedom,

original: sāhibkaula iti prathāvati pade nirmāti yaḥ smāsanam /🔽tatkāvye śivaśaktipūrvakavilāsānūddhṛte saṃbhṛte
analyzed: sāhibkaulaḥ iti prathāvati pade nirmāti yaḥ sma āsanam  tad kāvye śiva śakti pūrvaka vilāsa anu uddhṛte saṃbhṛte
translated: The one who created the seat in the famous position of Sahibbakoul,

analyzed: śakti aṅkena vilāsa nāmni mahitā bhaktiḥ gatā pañcamī  iti śrī mahā māheśvara ācārya varya śrī sāhiba kaula ānandanātha viracite
translated: In that poem, the fifth devotion is accomplished, extracted from the play of Shiva and Shakti,🔽In the play named Shaktyanka, is honored.🔽Thus ends the fifth devotion in the Name Play,
composed by the illustrious Sahibbakoul Anandanaatha, the foremost teacher of the great Maheshavara doctrine.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhī bhaktiḥ
translated: The sixth devotion

analyzed: stotra īśe smin muni raha mahantā parāmarśa hetu
translated: In this Stotreesha, I, the sage, am the cause of the supreme experience of the sense of self,

analyzed: chandaḥ anuṣṭubh kathitamakathā devatā sa ādi śaktiḥ
translated: The meter is anuṣṭubh, the deity is said to be with the initial power,

analyzed: nānā siddhau bhavati viniyogaḥ caturdhā prasiddhe
translated: The application is for the attainment of various things, well-known in the four ways,

analyzed: puṃbhāve vā smṛti japa huta adhyetṛ tā tarpaṇeṣu
translated: In the state of being a man, in remembering, reciting, offering oblations, and satisfying.

original: śambhuścakre yāni nāmāni devadevyāḥ spaṣṭaṃ pūrvamuddeśapūrvam /
analyzed: śambhuḥ cakre yāni nāmāni devadevyāḥ spaṣṭam pūrvam uddeśa pūrvam
translated: And Shambhu, the god of gods, clearly created these names before, with a prior declaration.

analyzed: sa ahib kaulaḥ tāni bhakti eka vaśyaḥ vṛttaiḥ artham lakṣayadbhiḥ babandha  /
translated: Sahibbakoul, being solely devoted, bound them with verses that indicate the meaning.

analyzed: viṣṇu māyā abhidhe siddha sarasvatī api varṇite
translated: It is also described in the Siddha Sarasvati named Vishnu Maya,

analyzed: paryāyeṇa iha ṣaṣṭhyā ca taruṇa ākhyā upapāditā
translated: The sixth one is produced here by the one named Taruna, in a series.

original: kvāpi kvāpyanyanāmāni vigrahāntaritāni ca /🔽varṇitāni na dūṣyāṇi tānyudbhāvanayā svayam // //
analyzed: kvāpi kvāpi anya nāmāni vigraha antaritāni ca  varṇitāni na dūṣyāṇi tāni udbhāvanayā svayam
translated: In some places, with different names and different forms,🔽described, not to be criticized, by the manifestation of one's own.

analyzed: nirābhāsā upi ādau aham iti samābhāsya vividhaiḥ
translated: Even though devoid of manifestation, at first, having manifested the idea of I,

original: svaśaṅkāṅkairbhāvaṃ svamiva malinairyojayati yaḥ /🔽pratīpaṃ prajñānātpunarapi tamevādbhutamayaṃ
analyzed: sva śaṅkā aṅkaiḥ bhāvam svam iva malinaiḥ yojayati yaḥ  pratīpam prajñānāt punar api tam eva adbhuta mayam
translated: he who connects his own state with various stains of his own doubts,🔽again and again, remembering that very wonderful one, with wisdom turned away,

original: smaratyekaṃ sadyaḥ kimapi ca cidātmaiṣa jayati // //
analyzed: smarati ekam sadyas kim api ca cit ātmā eṣa jayati
translated: that very self-luminous consciousness triumphs suddenly.

analyzed: niścetyā api vicetya bhāva kalanā ābhāsa svarūpā iva yā
translated: She who, though devoid of consciousness, appears in the form of the manifestation of the idea of being conscious,

original: yaikāpyeva mateṣu bhūriṣu paraṃ nānākhyayā śrūyate /🔽yā janmādividhau vibhurvimalabhā asyātmatantrā parā
analyzed: mateṣu bhūriṣu param nānā ākhyayā śrūyate  yā janma ādi vidhau vibhuḥ vimala bhā asya ātmatantrā parā
translated: who, though one only, is heard in many opinions under various names,🔽who, in the process of birth and so on, is the all-pervading, pure light, the supreme one independent of her own self,

analyzed: sā eṣā kācid akhaṇḍa harṣa vibhavā cit sphūrjatāt sva tviṣā
translated: she is this consciousness, having the power of unbroken bliss, shining forth with her own radiance.

analyzed: param atulam anantam bodhayati ātma bhāvam
translated: She awakens the incomparable, infinite self-existence,

analyzed: viracayati ca sadyas mṛtyu cintā apahāram
translated: and instantly removes the thought of death.

analyzed: rasayati rasarājam sarvatas pūrṇa pūrṇam
translated: She tastes the elixir, completely full everywhere,

analyzed: mama matiḥ atha ca evam śakti nāmnām vilāsaḥ
translated: and thus my mind is the play of the names of powers.

original: śṛṅgārī svamatau hasañ janagatiṃ bhakteṣu kāruṇyavān
analyzed: śṛṅgārī sva matau hasam jana gatim bhakteṣu kāruṇyavān
translated: The lover, smiling in his own mind, compassionate towards devotees in the ways of the world,

analyzed: vīra uhaṅkṛti pātane bhrama tatau raudraḥ manaḥ karmaṇām
translated: The hero, in the downfall of ego, wandering in the two states, fierce in the actions of mind,

analyzed: bhīteḥ hetuḥ asat jugupsana paraḥ sarva aikya līlā adbhutaḥ
translated: The cause of fear, devoted to the censure of the wicked, wonderful in the play of the unity of all,

analyzed: an apihita bhāva bodhām nānā kāma adhika āmitām vibudhaiḥ
translated: The Lord of the Rasa of the Sahibs and Kaulas, victorious, shining with the nature of peace.🔽I praise that supreme goddess of knowledge, who awakens the hidden truth, who is more desirable than various desires,

analyzed: abhinava rasarājīm tām para ādi vidyeśvarīm vande
translated: And who is the foremost of all, the goddess of knowledge.
The great knowledge.

analyzed: parā yā cit rūpā sphurita vibhava antar smṛtavatī
translated: The supreme one, whose form is consciousness, remembering the abundance of brilliance within,

original: bahu syāmityekā tadanu tanute tatsamamidam /🔽vicitraṃ śuddhādhvaprabhṛtimativiśrāmamabhidā
analyzed: bahu syām iti ekā tadanu tanute tat samam idam  vicitram śuddha adhva prabhṛti mati viśrāmam abhidā
translated: Says, Let me be manifold, and then produces this equal to itself.🔽The wonderful, pure path and so on, with a different identity,

analyzed: mahāvidyā anādyā viśada sukha de yacchatu pade
translated: May the beginningless great knowledge, which gives clear bliss, grant that state.
The mother of the world.

analyzed: prasūte hūtena pratiniyata rūpeṇa ca parā
translated: She who gives birth to the supreme, which is to be contemplated in a specific form,

analyzed: nirūpyam cit rūpā jagat aga mayam niṣparicayam
translated: The form of consciousness, which has become the world, without any acquaintance,

original: p / prapañcaṃ yā svacchā muhuriha gṛṇantaṃ jhagiti māṃ
analyzed: prapañcam yā su acchā muhur iha gṛṇantam mām
translated: The clear one, who quickly grants me, who is being sung about here again and again,

analyzed: jaganmātā pātāt jagat agha nipātāt bhagavatī  /
translated: May the Blessed Lady, the Mother of the Universe, protect the world from the fall of sins.

analyzed: mahālakṣmīḥ
translated: Mahalaxmi.

original: sa bhikṣutvaṃ dikṣu śrayati nahi yatsaṃśrayavaśāt
analyzed: sa bhikṣu tvam dikṣu śrayati nahi yad saṃśraya vaśāt
translated: He who, by resorting to which, does not attain the state of a mendicant,

original: praśāstā daityānāṃ patirapi ca patyurbhavati yā /
analyzed: praśāstā daityānām patiḥ api ca patyuḥ bhavati yā
translated: And who, though the lord of the demons, becomes the lord of the lord.

analyzed: hṛdi sthityā nityam viracayatu daurgatyam abhitas
translated: By residing in the heart, may she always bring about misfortune all around,

analyzed: mahā lakṣmīḥ sā naḥ lalita phalitā durgati tateḥ
translated: May that Mahalaxmi, who is full of grace, protect us from the state of misfortune.
Shivapriya.

analyzed: yat āsaktaḥ naktan dina mina padam tat su vipadam
translated: When one is attached to it day and night, that is a great misfortune,

original: viditvā dattvāḍhyaṃ sa śiva itarebhyaḥ svayamalam /
analyzed: viditvā dattvā āḍhyam sa śivaḥ itarebhyaḥ svayam alam
translated: Knowing this, having given wealth, he is himself sufficient for others.

original: śmaśāne niḥśūnye vasati ca paraṃ nandati śiva
analyzed: śmaśāne niḥśūnye vasati ca param nandati śiva
translated: He resides in the desolate cremation ground, and is supremely delighted,

analyzed: priyā dhyeyā deyāt sahaja nija bhakti śriyam iyam
translated: May that Shivapriya, the glory of natural and inherent devotion, be meditated upon and given.
Vishnumāya.

analyzed: vinirmāya sphāyat sahaja nija tantra tva vibhavā
translated: By whom, having created the glory of inherent independence,

original: daho mohaṃ dhatte svayamapi yayedaṃ śritagatiḥ /🔽sa viṣṇuścāpyātmā vitatamitamātṛbhramamayā
analyzed: dahaḥ moham dhatte svayam api yayā idam śrita gatiḥ  sa viṣṇuḥ ca api ātmā vitata mita mātṛ bhrama mayā
